name: Gossip
announce
comeback
tour
to
mark
years
of
‘Music
For
Men’
content:
"It’ll be a sweaty, outrageous time for sure"Gossip have announced their first tour in seven years to mark the 10th anniversary of their seminal album ‘Music For Men’.The comeback shows from the US punk heroes marks their first tour in seven years and kicks off in France on July 4, before wrapping up in Dublin in mid-August.“We can’t believe it’s been 10 years since the release of Music For Men!  We are beyond excited to reunite with our Gossip family and fans,” said the band.“We’ve truly missed playing these songs and connecting with our amazing and inspiring crowds. It’ll be a sweaty, outrageous time for sure. Can’t wait to see y’all in Europe in July!”Check out the string of dates in full below. Tickets are on sale from 9am on Friday March 29 and will be available here.JULY
4 – Beuregard Festival
5 – Palladium, Cologne, Germany
6 – Tempodrom, Berlin, Germany
8 – Salle Playel, Paris, France
12 – Nos Alive Festival, Lisbon, Portugal
15 – Den Atelier, Luxembourg
16 – Paradisco, Amsterdam, The Netherlands
19 – SWG3 Galvanisers Yard, Glasgow, UK
20 – Academy, Manchester, UK
21 – Somerset House, London, UKAUGUST
18 – Love Sensation, Dublin, IrelandReviewing ‘Music for Men’ back in 2009, NME wrote: “For the most part, though, this is a frivolous, joyful celebration: of all love, heartbreak, sex and dancing. If the band was formed as a means of escaping the closed-mindedness of their Southern backgrounds, then this is the fruits of their emancipation. And who can deny them that?”
